structural_data.location_detail: N-terminal region critical for GTP/GDP binding and nucleotide exchange

structural_impact.reason: Glycine→Valine substitution increases side-chain volume (~100 Å³ expansion)
structural_impact.consequence: Altered conformational dynamics in Switch I/II regions affecting GTPase activity
structural_impact.impact_on_gdp_binding: Compromised GDP release; impaired GTPase-activating protein (GAP) interactions

functional_impact.mechanism: Loss of GTPase intrinsic activity + impaired GAP-mediated GTP hydrolysis

cancer_association.g12_hotspot_frequency: G12 is the most common KRAS mutation site in CRC
cancer_association.clinical_significance: Associated with worse prognosis and therapy resistance

existing_drugs: KRAS G12C inhibitors (not applicable - G12V is different)
MEK inhibitors (trametinib, selumetinib) - target downstream MAPK
emerging_approaches: Combination therapies targeting multiple KRAS effector pathways
therapeutic_implications.resistance_mechanisms: High frequency of secondary mutations affecting RAF, MEK, TP53

structural_stability_prediction.overall_structure: Protein fold remains stable; local conformational changes in Switch regions
structural_stability_prediction.thermodynamic_stability: ΔΔG ≈ -1 to -2 kcal/mol (slight destabilization or neutral)

recommendation: PATHOGENIC VARIANT - Functional driver mutation in CRC. Recommend targeted therapy strategies.
